titleStmt.title: The Court & kitchin of Elizabeth, commonly called Joan Cromwel the wife of the late usurper, truly described and represented, and now made publick for general satisfaction.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Milbourn for Randal Taylor ...,

notesStmt.note: Satire on the Protector's wife, notably on her alleged parsimony in household mangement; includes family anecdotes and a collection of recipes purporting to be those used by her.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
